questions.q: Which attribute is used to set the style of an HTML element?
questions.explanation: The style attribute is used to apply inline styles, such as color, font, and size, directly to an HTML element [1], [2].

questions.q: Which property is used to define the background color for an HTML element?
questions.explanation: The background-color property defines the background color for an HTML element [3]. While 'bgcolor' was used as an attribute in older versions, 'background-color' is the CSS property used within a style attribute [4], [5].

questions.q: In HTML, which tag is used to define a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: Hyperlinks are defined with the <a> (anchor) tag [6], [2].

questions.q: What is the most important attribute of the <a> element, used to indicate the link's destination?
questions.explanation: The href attribute indicates the destination of the link [7], [8].

questions.q: Which attribute is used to open a linked document in a new browser window or tab?
questions.explanation: Setting the target attribute to '_blank' allows the browser to open the link in another page or tab [7], [9].

questions.q: True or False: A link can only be applied to text.
questions.explanation: False. A link does not have to be text; it can be an image or any other HTML element [10], [6].

questions.q: Which scheme should be used inside the href attribute to create a link that opens the user's email program?
questions.explanation: The mailto: scheme is used inside the href attribute to create an email link [11], [8].

questions.q: To create a bookmark and jump to a specific part of a page, which attribute must you first add to the target element?
questions.explanation: To make a bookmark, you must first create it using the id attribute on an element, and then link to it using href='#idName' [11], [12].

It must be used inside a

tag.
questions.explanation: The tag is empty, meaning it contains attributes only and does not have a closing tag [13].

questions.q: Which attribute is required for an tag to provide alternate text if the image cannot be displayed?
questions.explanation: The alt attribute is required and provides alternate text for an image [13], [14].

questions.q: What is the recommended method for defining the width and height of an image?
options: Using the style attribute with CSS properties
questions.explanation: It is recommended to use the style attribute for width and height to define the size of the image [13], [14].

questions.q: Which tag is used to define an unordered (bulleted) list?
questions.explanation: An unordered list is created using the <ul> tag [15], [16].

questions.q: Which tag is used to define a single list item within either an ordered or unordered list?
questions.explanation: Each list item starts with the <li> tag [16], [17].

questions.q: What is the default numbering scheme for an ordered list (<ol>)?
questions.explanation: By default, the numbering for an ordered list starts at one (1) and is incremented by one for each item [17], [18].

questions.q: In a description list (<dl>), which tag is used to define the term or name?
questions.explanation: The <dt> tag defines the term (name) in a description list, while <dd> describes each term [19], [20].

questions.q: Which attribute is used with the <ol> tag to specify the starting point of the numbering?
questions.explanation: The start attribute for the <ol> tag is used to specify the starting point of the numbering [21].
